intro: Baliospermum calycinum var. nepalense, commonly known as the Nepal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or violet flowers that open in the morning and close at dusk. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the stems are slender and twining. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at moderate elevations.
